title: @Riot: I am all for counterbuilding, but...
body:
What exactly am I (Teemo) supposed to do here?

http://i.imgur.com/2hJlfSp.png?noredirect

This costs literally 0 gold and have relatively short cooldown with high duration. One of them is gamebreaking for Teemo, but 5 of them? They can have Oracle up over 83% of the time. Add to this Scrying Plants, ** Control Wards** and Duskblade (surprisingly absent from this game in particular) and Teemo doesn't have an ultimate (Shaco and Jhin don't have their Ws).

I know everyone hates Teemo and his shrooms, but I believe it's way too easy to counter them nowadays (was pretty bad since the introduction of Oracle Alteration). I really would like to see Riot's opinion on this matter.

http://68.media.tumblr.com/63889aac171b4bf1d7b476e6700e19a6/tumblr_nq206emQ5J1syf8nwo2_250.gif

Uh, it's not about it detecting traps - that is necessary and have to be in the game one way or another. It's about them being disabled and the effect being way too common currently.

I prefer the trap disable because of Shaco. Those boxes will work even if you can see them and try to take them out, so I prefer them being disabled.

Teemo's shrooms, though, that's a bit unfair.

What if everything is trapped and the entire section of the path is unavailable to even navigate through, without stepping in one of those? Some traps cannot be destroyed and not being able to disable them effectively deters people from even having that trapped path available as an option.

I'm not sure about where this puts Teemo on the map but Cait and Nidalee definitely need this to exist or their zoning becomes problematic.

I am not asking for removing the tools to destroy traps.

Just the disable effect should not be so freely available on everything - for free too.

Control Wards and Scrying plants are fine.

Control Wards have a decent radius and serve as a control point of the team who set it up so if they manage to hold it, it stands to reason you cannot kill the ward, therefore you cannot put traps in that specific area.

Scrying Plant is also fine since it's an environmental entity, not something that is guaranteed to be there and it doesn't cover the entire map.

I'm not sure in what ELO you're playing but in Diamond, i've never seen people actually buy 5 Oracle Alterations to counter one Teemo - ever. This must've been Flex Queue or a team. 
That Marksman Graves pick, support Lux and Akali mid is just a sign to me that it might not have been ranked at all. I'm a support main in Diamond and whenever i see Teemo, i urge my team to buy as many Oracle Alterations as we can but no one actually pays me any heed and people just run into shrooms all day. So if Diamond players don't listen, you'd need a team of friends who will listen to each other. That has been my experience with Teemo in ranked, even if he's so easy to counter in this fashion.

The bottom line is that if the way isn't well known or adopted, i see no reason why Riot should take action and make changes in this direction, unless it's a problem already.

Trap disabling should not be a thing. There are five traps in the game, and the ones with issues should be solved by adding more counterplay directly to them, not by allowing a cheap item to hard-counter them. This is precisely the kind of situation Riot was trying to avoid when they reworked stealth and prevented Control Wards from disabling short-term invisibility.

There are currently two types of traps: invisible traps, namely Teemo's, Shaco's and Jhin's, and visible traps, namely Caitlyn's and Nidalee's. Out of the three different invisible traps, Jhin's set a good model for the rest: they don't deal initial damage, offer the player time to react and avoid said damage, and can be detonated "safely" by stepping on them and retreating if you know exactly where they are. Captive Audience already has a ton of counterplay without the need to be disabled by another item. That same model could easily be ported to Shaco's Jack In The Box, since those things usually wind up before popping out and scaring people, though he likely deserves much more than just that change, including buffs to his AD playstyle. For Teemo, you could also implement the same counterplay by, say, having mushrooms jump into the air before detonating, which would give a warning without disrupting his waveclear too hard. Honestly, both Teemo and Shaco need larger-scale reworks farther down the line, and those reworks should improve the counterplay to their traps.

As for visible traps, I think the best solution might just be to give them a set amount of health, or have minions set them off (or both, though Nidalee's traps already detonate on minions). It's silly for Caitlyn to lay down a bunch of traps directly under your tower without you being able to do anything about it, and the solution shouldn't be to buy an item specifically to turn them off. Basically, if traps need additional counterplay, that should be implemented directly onto the traps themselves, not through an exceedingly niche hard-counter effect tacked onto vision denial.

You can't count on that here. xD

But they still have 3 wards + any control wards they bought (usually not many). Add to that scrying plants and the fact that their vision denial is excellent (they might not have much vision, but neither will you against them) and there's very little to abuse.

I think another thing you could have done is focused on placing your shrooms where fights would occur. Or, you could bait the enemy team with the shrooms. If you had a tanky front line with CC who could engage or peel for you, that's a free pick. It takes a bit of time to clear a shroom or 4, and abusing that time would create a situation where the enemy either has to take a risk dying to clear the shroom or run and you retain control of that area.

Additionally, you could just be a dick and ZZ'rot the lanes, and rotate/get objectives as they rushed to stop the mayhem. Putting shrooms around the Zz'rots would make for the most pleasant feeling as you get to waste their time and potentially get a kill.

Alternatively, I've seen Teemo's go on-hit with frozen mallet, BoRK, etc, relying a lot less on shrooms and more on the fact that nobody can really tank them effectively. If you feel that the enemy has a lot of trap denial the on-hit build is for you.
